thread.title: Daredevil takes aerial video of Winnipeg from crane
thread.title_full: Daredevil takes aerial video of Winnipeg from crane

title: Daredevil takes aerial video of Winnipeg from crane
text:
Report an error 
See downtown Winnipeg while dangling with one arm from a crane? 
It’s not something most of us would consider, but it’s what one person has apparently done. 
In a YouTube video published last month by a user under the name of “Sam Armstrong,” a young man is seen climbing various downtown buildings and looking out from rooftops. 
The danger factor then soars to new heights, when the daredevil climbs a crane being used for the expansion of the RBC Convention Centre. 
WATCH: Daredevils scale world's second tallest building 
With MTS Centre, Portage Place mall, and office towers seen below, a young man wearing a GoPro camera tiptoes onto the crane, then proceeds to swing his legs out over the city, hanging from his two hands. He then briefly has one hand let go of the crane, flashing it on camera before grabbing the crane again and climbing back up. 
Urban climbing has become something of a recent phenomenon, with people making dangerous climbs and posting their efforts after the fact to social media sites, like YouTube. In July, six men were arrested in Vancouver after climbing a crane, and Halifax has seen multiple incidents within the past year. Reader's comments »
